Reviews.Title: good!
Reviews.Author: scania1983
Reviews.Content: great product! my son loved it. apps need to be purchased separately and they are not cheap! other than that, this thing looks and feels like it will stand the test of time

Reviews.Title: Leapfrog four ever!
Reviews.Author: amanuel haile
Reviews.Content: The Feature app is arrive nice and my son likes it he can't sleep Without Leapfrog. He learn a lot from leapfrog

Reviews.Title: My grandson loves it!
Reviews.Author: Trudy Tierney
Reviews.Content: My three year old grandson loves his LeapPad2!  He didn't even need anyone to show him how to use it!

Reviews.Title: My Grandson loves it!
Reviews.Author: Gail Issen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my grandson's fourth birthday. He is absolutely delighted with this present. He calls it his very own computer.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Katie Massey
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son's 4th birthday. He loves it! There are a variety of games and accessories that go with it. I love that he is learning to read, write, do math, problem solving, and more - all while playing a fun game! I would definitely recommend this product to others!

Reviews.Title: LeapPad 2 Re-Charger Failed After 5 Months
Reviews.Author: Mo in MD
Reviews.Content: My 4 year old grand-daughter loved the gift for Christmas but 5 months later the rechargeable battery pack does not hold a charge. I now understand this is a common problem with the LeapPad 2 re-charger.  I find I cannot resolve through Amazon to the retailer, I will have to pursue with the retailer/manufacturer on my own.  I know already this will not be easy or convenient for me since my grand-daughter is on the West coast and I am on the East coast.  I would have thought being an Amazon Prime Member would afford me that Amazon would resolve deficiency with the manufacture.

Reviews.Title: Returned it, waste of money
Reviews.Author: Ryan Bray "sdguero"
Reviews.Content: So, we already own a couple of real tablets that our duaghter likes to play with. Fearing that she would break a >$300 device we bought this. I sent it back 2 days after it arrived for several reasons. The leapfrog2 came out in 2012, so i figured it would at least have decent hardware on par with like a first gen ipad with a worse screen. I was wrong. This thing is simply archaic.1. There are no usable apps pre-loaded on the device. I know it says there are like 10 apps int eh description, but none of them are worth spending 30 seconds on.2. There are no free apps available in the leapfrog app store. The decent ones are all $10, which is rediculous in 2014, when most apps on real tablets have free versions avialable to try out and are less than $5 to buy if you like them.3. No wifi connectivity. Installing software required hooking up to a computer via USB cable. I knew about this before we bought it, but still super lame.4 The camera is terrible. It's like a cell phone from 2006.5. The screen is tiny, and also terrible. Again like a cell phone from 2006.6. The stylus is unnnecessary and an eye poke hazard. In the 10 minutes that my daughter played with this thing, she nearly poked herself in the eye twice.I don't know why this thing has so many good reviews on Amazon. I wouldn't pay $20 for it, much less $90. That is why we sent it back (Thanks Amazon!).Save yourself the trouble of returning this thing and spend a little more on a low end android of iOS tablet.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Jane E Murray
Reviews.Content: My daughter plays with it all the time. It has great teaching games! It has a protective case on it and it's seeming to be indestructible!

Reviews.Title: Great learning tool for kids, and fun.
Reviews.Author: T. Booth
Reviews.Content: My nephew loves this.  He's five, we got this for his birthday.  He brings it everytime he comes to Grandpa's.  His favorite toy, and he's learning alot at the same time.

Reviews.Title: glass broke very easily for a kids toy.
Reviews.Author: Tanner Hughes
Reviews.Content: glass broke very easily for a kids toy. we didnt have it for 2 weeks before it became useless. this might as well of been a waste of 100$

Reviews.Title: good durability
Reviews.Author: Robert Dobson
Reviews.Content: its been dropped, thrown, kicked, drugged around and thrown up on... twice and still workin good. good shipping and nice packaging. the cartridges are 20-25 bucks per game. its been in operation for over a year now and child still likes it.

Reviews.Title: My daughter LOVES this!
Reviews.Author: Mom3
Reviews.Content: Both my daughters have the Leapsters but they kept begging for this. I found this and loved the price! I bought this one for my 4 year old and the sofia the first one off the Leap Frog site for my 6 year old. They LOVE these!!! Def worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Total waste of money...kids lose interest in it FAST
Reviews.Author: K. Gilbert "Fantasy Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: We thought we were being smart by purchasing this LeapPad verses the Ultra because of all the poor reviews from so many disappointed parents.  Our 6 year old showed a lot of interest when we first introduced this to him, of course he did, it was new.  However, the games for this are ridiculously over priced for what you actually get.  We would buy him a game and he either beat it or lost interest with it within a day or two.  The apps and games are also ridiculously priced, and most of the games are way...way to "generic".  They have a few Disney/Pixar themed games, but most of them are lame....sorry.  LeapPad's in general, in my opinion at least, are a major waste of money.  The video camera that is built in is horrid, all grainy and very low quality.  At best this is a possibly "OK" toy for a 3-4 year old, kids are WAY to advanced nowadays for such a limited tablet.  It's freaking incredibly annoying because it constantly repeats directions over and over again regardless of how many times you've played.  Like the art app, every 5 seconds it repeats the directions until you want to throw the thing out the window.  It's a money trap for Parent's, they keep sending all kinds of promotions to keep buying the apps and games...and very few of them are worth the money they ask for.  No...sorry, if I could I would tell anyone to stay far far away from LeapPad.  If you want a tablet that is decent, get your kid a Kindle Fire and just teach them to be responsible with it.

Reviews.Title: Sound quit working
Reviews.Author: Kathe Cutsforth
Reviews.Content: The sound quit working after 2 1/2 months.  It is very disappointing to a child.  It is a lot of money to spend for an item to last such a short time.

Reviews.Title: 3 Year Old Loves It, Mom Thinks Apps are Too Expensive
Reviews.Author: Mayflower Girl "amazon-junkie since 1996"
Reviews.Content: We have four kids.  My older kids all had Leapsters and I'm a big fan of LeapFrog and their products.  However, I think they need to realize that they can't charge $25 for an app these days, when my kids can buy an app for their Kindle Fire or iPad for 99 cents.  I understand that cartridges used to be $20, but the market has moved on.  I also hated that I had to hook up the LeapPad to my computer via a USB cable to update anything.  The advantages of the LeapPad is it's much more durable than a typical tablet (not sure compared to the Nabi, and the LeapFrog games have been tested and perfected for years.  My kids love playing the games…but more than the other apps? I can't say that.I loved (and my daughter loved) the Doc McStuffins design.  It's adorable.  The LeapPad is pretty easy to set up.  You have to put the rechargeable batteries in (put the square like tab in first…then the cylinder)…and charge it, before connecting it to your computer to download the 9 free apps.  The $20 card it came with is great, but once again, with the price of the apps, you can still end up shelling out $5 for a lot of apps, or might get one to download without additional money.Once again, I'm a big fan of their products, but I don't see that this is any better than the Kindle Fire with FreeTime we have for the kids, or even a regular iPad.  The price point for the LeapPad is less, but with the $30 off deals for KindleFire, and the Prime deal on Free Time which gives you new monthly content for your kids, you'll end up saving long term.If LeapFrog dropped the price on their apps, nothing should be more than $9.99, and most should be under $5.00, then I'd give it five stars.  But with the price of the apps today, I can't.

Reviews.Title: Bright, shiny, and pretty!
Reviews.Author: Gertrude, the Innocent "Live well, laugh loud...
Reviews.Content: We are huge fans of all things LeapFrog. Our children have grown up with a variety of LeapFrog handhelds and other devices that have served them well in teaching them reading and math, and even logic and reasoning skills. I love the effortlessness of the games and education. Education should be fun and should be rewarding: it sets children up with a lifelong love of reading and learning.This is the second of our themed LeapPad2s and this is another winner. These colors are a welcome change to the longstanding green or pink variations - which really were a sad selection of colors - oh, and before that, the white didjes. Our first Bundled set was LeapFrog LeapPad2 Disney/Pixar Monsters University Varsity Edition Bundle and it is just gorgeous. It even has little horns on the top of the gel skin featuring Mike.I like these bundle packages especially. The value to them is better than buying the parts, separately of course. The included battery pack is also a great improvement to these devices. The battery pack is a game changer.Once you set this LeapPad2 up with the basic info and connect it to your computer, the update should happen pretty quickly. Mine didn't take a full minute. It downloads the apps: Learning Songs, Art Studio, Clock, Calendar, NotePad and calendar and one app you choose from the 3 offered. Every time I have set a LeapPad up lately, I have been offered a discount based on how many apps I buy, up to 30% off from 3 or more. This deal is far better than the discounts that come in emails and I try to make sure I take advantage of them, even using my extra digital download cards to stock up.Multiple device app downloads: For a long time, you needed to purchase one app for each device, unless you ordered the game cartridges. LeapFrog has become a lot more reasonable lately. With these more recent LeapPad 2s and Ultras we are now able to purchase an app once and download it on up to three devices. This was a long time coming but they certainly made me appreciate it when it happened. There is something of a guessing game that goes on when I run up against a usage limit on one of the apps and then have to find which device it is on. This has happened to us with Stretchy Monkey, Reef Builder, Letter Factory, Elements on the Loose, Scooby Doo Spelling, and Disney Planes. These have been the favorite apps, by far. It is still better than only being able to download one app to one device.You can buy download cards on Amazon at various prices. I keep them in my shopping cart and watch the prices. The lowest I had ever seen was at $14, except for one brief shining moment. But when you combine these cards with the discounts you will get through emails, they can bring the price of apps down significantly. I buy them on sale and then wait until I hook up a new device so that I get the first hookup discount. :DAnother thing that I love as a teacher, a parent, and a grandparent, is how responsive LeapFrog is to suggestions and requests by parents and teachers.

Reviews.Title: This was a gift
Reviews.Author: Andrea Thomas
Reviews.Content: I ordered this as a gift for a 22 month old girl. Who loves electronics, her mother tells me she carries it everywhere she goes and just loves it. She is learning how to write the alphabets and loves to read her books.

Reviews.Title: Best LeapPad 2
Reviews.Author: Fabienne
Reviews.Content: I bought this LeapPad for my 2yr old daughter for Christmas. I was a little worried that it would be a bit too advanced for her but she's been using it great and I found apps that work great for her. She also adores the Doc McStuffins theme.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Being that I am a teacher, educational toys are a must have in my household. We purchased the leap pad for my daughter's third birthday. She immediately opened it and began exploring. Normally I don't like her to be attached to electronics but with the leap pad I don't mind. It works on so many skills such handwriting, fine motor skills, shapes, etc that I can't say no when she asks to play with it. What a great product!

Reviews.Title: love this toy....
Reviews.Author: gisel james
Reviews.Content: I got this toy for my four year old son. He loves it..it work very well..can't put it dowm, he love to dra and paint so the create my own art is his favorite...

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment this is!
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: It comes with a couple games already installed (why doesn't the animal have a body btw?) and it is remarkable how outdated the technology behind them is!  My daughter is 3 and thinks its a joke.  She does however love the advertisements (the games got boring fast).  She loves to play them over and over ... not really worth 80 bucks. Additional games cost $15-25 and based on the quality of those included on the device, they cannot possibly be worth it.  The Kindle Fire has loads of games and books for free or only a couple bucks and the games are far superior to what I have seen on Leap Pad.  I really wish someone had advised me against wasting this money.

Reviews.Title: Should Have Gotten A Kindle Fire HD ...
Reviews.Author: delicateflower152
Reviews.Content: The “LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet, Green” is a sturdy tablet for younger children.  Based on LeapFrog’s reputation and the reviews of this tablet posted on Amazon, I purchased the “LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet” for my four-year old grandson.  I also purchased the “LeapPad get Ready for 1st Grade Game Bundle for Boys” directly from LeapFrog since it was not available from Amazon.Weighing 15.8 oz., the LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet is sturdy enough to withstand young, enthusiastic users’ handling.  The 2 9/16” X 3 7/8” screen is quite small and images depicted on it are less detailed than adults might like.  However, children do seem to find the cartoon figures and graphics appealing.  Instructions included with the tablet were lacking in detail and provide little assistance when it comes to setting up the LeapPad2.  Games in the bundles I purchased are not particularly engaging.  My grandson liked watching the Cars cartridge because it included Lightening McQueen and Mater; I was less than impressed with the educational value of the cartridge.Although my grandson loves his “pad”, I think a Kindle Fire HD would have been a more practical and useful choice.  It has a larger screen, the cost of the game/learning apps is less than the price of LeapFrog cartridges; and the support for Kindle is far superior to LeapFrog’s.  If you are looking for a sturdy tablet for younger children, you may want to consider the “LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet”.  If you are looking for a functional, useful tablet and will be using it with your little one, then I definitely recommend you purchase a Kindle Fire HD instead.  I wish I had done so.

Reviews.Title: She's nuts about this!
Reviews.Author: Donna R Brown
Reviews.Content: My little one loves this thing so much, she won't even put if down long enough to recharge it! Throws a fit when we need to take it from her to charge it, so we tell her her leapfrog needs a nap, and for now that's working, but it know that won't last long...we're just happy that she loves this device and that she's learning which is the most important thing...you'll love it for your child...

Reviews.Title: 21 month old daughter LOVES IT!!
Reviews.Author: Kasi Jones
Reviews.Content: I planed to get my daughter a LeapLap Power for her 'big' christmas gift and when I found out there was a Doc Mcstuffins package and that it was even cheaper than the basic Power I was very excited!! My daughter absolutely adores this thing!! There arent a lot of games for toddlers, but she loves the drawing app and just holding it and pushing on the touch screen and taking pictures.Google 'Free Leappad Codes'!! There are 2 codes for free apps to download!

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: Bunny887
Reviews.Content: My son got a green one and my daughter got the pink one.  My son's won't read the games and my daughter's won't connect to the computer, it says connect when it's connected.  So I been trying to get them to work.  Some of the apps are pricey too.

Reviews.Title: Headache of a Tablet
Reviews.Author: Noodle
Reviews.Content: The average American consumer is dumb. That must explain why this device gets a 5 star rating. Get your kid an i-pad, field for educational apps which are WAY cheaper, and avoid all this "downloading software onto your PC and paying an arm and a leg for the LeapPad apps" business! This thing is a headache.

Reviews.Title: Looks like a kids toy but is super limited.
Reviews.Author: MedicD
Reviews.Content: Apps are expensive! My wife talked me into buying this thing vs getting a cheap android tablet with a big case. This is going to end up costing a lot more than the other device and does a lot less. I see no benefits to this device vs a cheap "real" tablet and installing some of the 20,000 FREE apps on the Android market. You can't even get it to play music without spending another $10!!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it sounds
Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: i wanted to buy something that is more appropriate for my 2 and 1/2 year-old son to play with, so based on the good reviews i bought Leappad 2. However, after i received the item and installed it, it kinda disappointed me, the included 9 apps were not as good as i thought, in fact they were quite boring. The most disappointing part was the resolution of the camera, it was quite low, not as clear as the video ad that i saw online. Just Like other reviewers have mentioned, whatever app you wanna download they are quite expensive. if you want more educational apps or games for your child theyre gonna cost you a fortune. Besides all those cons, my son really likes ipad a lot better than leappad 2 cuz he can get many music video online and save them to my ipad, and the games many are for free.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous device for 21/2 -5yr.olds
Reviews.Author: gloria wohlgemuth
Reviews.Content: I bought the Leapfrog after reading the reviews and also talking to my daughter-in-law who is very "savvy" when it comes to electrionic devices..and I am very happy to report that it has lived up to it's reputation in every way..my grandaughter is completely in "love" with it and her parents have to moniter her use otherwise she'd be on it all day !

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Justin L Anderson
Reviews.Content: If I knew how awesome this thing was before I bought it, I would have picked it up when my daughter was two years old! Apps are great and the item is extremely easy to use for my 3.5 year old. The camera requires a lot of light wherever you are, if you want a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: BrooklynNZ
Reviews.Content: I love the leap pad 2. My son was seriously addicted to my iPhone and I had downloaded games for him but I didn't like that he was starting to learn how to use youtube etc. (he's only 2) so we bought this instead. He loves it, it took him awhile to learn to use as it's different to the phone but it is a great learning tool and the money is worth it. This is half the price here then it is in New Zealand (even with shipping) so it's a great bargain for anyone. The recharger pack will save heaps on batteries. Overall, we are really happy with this purchase and can't wait to buy more games. Thanks for making this affordable Amazon!

Reviews.Title: light, fancy, fun
Reviews.Author: Sohee Heo
Reviews.Content: A design is very cute, it's very light.I select it as reviews on many blogs in Korea.Many Korean moms love it.

Reviews.Title: good if the customer care response ad well
Reviews.Author: saif
Reviews.Content: The product seems good for kids 5_12 years old , the screen resolution seems not good but for kids it is awesome , my device unable to connect to the app and that made my kids sick they need to play but could not , I contact the customer care but had no response yet , I wish they will replay soon. If not then I will writ a negative post about the product . The shipping and ptuce 5/5

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter during Christmas time. She was so excited to receive it. It was a great value and the rechargeable batteries are and irreplaceable asset. She plays on her pad for hours and often has her older (6 and 7) year old cousins wanting to play her pad instead of their own. I know everything on her pad is kid-propriate and the majority of the activities are teaching or reinforcing skills. I have no complaints at all about this product.

Reviews.Title: screen and camera leave much to be desired but otherwise a very good educational form of entertainment for kids
Reviews.Author: expert_101
Reviews.Content: Not going to write a detailed evaluation but I would say ultimately this is a decent purchase overall. The battery lasts pretty long (so far). The design is pretty simple for young ones to figure out. It's basically a simplified touch pad learning device. The speed is fast. Load up and shutdown is great. Not sure why we have to pay for the battery charger adapter as an extra accessory. Just about every other product would include this free. so that is kind of lame. The screen resolution is pretty bad as well. For $100 I don't expect "retina display" but I did expect better than what this screen offers. Like-wise, the camera feature, although very fun for children, looks like the old 2 megapixel cellphone cameras from 10 years ago. You pretty much need direct sunlight to get a decent snapshot. More importantly, my child is enjoying this product very much. I got this as an alternative to watching TV. There are lots of game cartridges that feature the popular shows on Disney, etc.. so this is a healthier alternative to watching the tube because it is interactive. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!!!
Reviews.Author: cinpot
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Grandson of 3 yrs and he loves it!!!  LeapFrog to me has always been one of the greatest learning tools out there for children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for my 2 year old granddaughter.
Reviews.Author: M. Thompson "graphdsnmouse"
Reviews.Content: I had to give this 5 stars, not something I often do. This was the perfect choice for my two year old granddaughters birthday gift. It is sturdy, easy to use, interactive with very colorful and engaging software. I purchased this particular type for the power ability. The battery life is excellent and easily charged.My granddaughter was able to immediately start using this, after mom gave her a couple quick lessons, and she loves to take it everywhere. The short lessons, videos and music are great for her little attention span. She has something to do while her older siblings play with there video games and the camera is so fun for her.I recommend getting the outer gel "skin" for extra protection and I purchased a small case with a handle for the game, software and misc. items to keep it all together. She can easily carry the case anywhere.P.S. Although its recommended for 3 and up, my 2 year old granddaughter has no problem operating most things after being showed once.

Reviews.Title: Poor Visual Technology - Daughter had little interest. Yet loves the Galaxy Tab and iPad
Reviews.Author: Isatu Bah "Isatu"
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this product. The technology seems so outdated compared to a tablet or iPad. I bought this for my daughter and she had little to no interest. She preferred the iPad. I received a deal on a Samsung Galaxy tab (free) when I purchased a phone and she enjoyed playing on it much more. There are a lot of learning apps on both android and apple products for free.

Reviews.Title: piece of junk!!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: My daughter dropped this from her car seat to the floor of the car and the screen cracked I called leap frog and "it is not replaceable due to the fact that my child dropped it"!! IT'S A CHILD'S TOY!!!!!!!!! They proceeded to tell me I could buy another one from them!!! If it can not withstand a small drop like that why would I want to buy another one??????? DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this piece of junk!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Learning tool
Reviews.Author: Karen Wampler
Reviews.Content: Grandkids all have one and love the Leap Pad 2 they love the games and the learning experience  good entertainment.

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet, Pink
Reviews.Author: Karen Alvarez
Reviews.Content: Very good product, everything I dreamed my daughter! It was a good buy, thanks! She loves to take it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: defective product
Reviews.Author: Jane Austin
Reviews.Content: The product suddenly stopped working within a month after my grandson started using it. I'd like to return it if it's not too late. I could not notify Amazon earlier because I was out of the country for a few months.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: B to the G "SeattleBeeGee"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my neighbor's son in order to liberate their iPad.  He *loves* it and is always using it.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for kiddos
Reviews.Author: wanderwonderwoman
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 3 year old as a Christmas gift, and he has absolutely LOVED it. The interactive books and videos are really reasonably priced, the games are a little too advanced for him (for now) mostly since they're geared more towards 5-7 year olds but he loves buying books on the leappad website with me. It's easy to plug in and download, and they email really great coupons a few times a month so it ends up being way cheaper buying it electronically instead of going to the store and getting those cartridges.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME GIFT FOR A GIRL
Reviews.Author: LOIS LARRIER
Reviews.Content: Wonderful.  Great tablet and great for the learning skills.  Price just right and fun to play with.  User friendly my niece daughter loves her birthday gift.  Awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: leap pad
Reviews.Author: Debbie Isaac
Reviews.Content: two of my grandchildren share this product and are doing quite well, playing games, learning their alphabets and numbers and practicing their printing.  Would recommend this to anyone with small children or grandchildren

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This device is perfect for any occasion, at Dr.appointments, grocery shopping, act. My daughter is constantly using it and wants to take it every where we go.

Reviews.Title: Daughter gets bored with it very quickly
Reviews.Author: Das Gooch
Reviews.Content: My 4 year old played with this twice for a total of 5 minutes.  Now it is relegated to duty as a coffee table for Barbee...

Reviews.Title: The twins love them.
Reviews.Author: jeannie
Reviews.Content: Play on them all the time.  Took a little time to download our preference games, but after that was done they are great.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Penny Pinching Polly "Check out my website fo...
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old loves the new features in the LeapPad 2 Power!  There's a calculator and a calendar.  It makes her feel a bit older - like mommy's smart phone.  She's put her school breaks in the calendar and other dates important to an 8 year old.  :)  The calculator she uses to play store.  There's also NotePad, which my daughter hasn't used yet.  She does love the clock & stop watch feature, which is not available on LeapPad 1.The included power supply is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Awesome leappad!
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Ruth
Reviews.Content: This is so awesome! Even though I wanted an iPad, my parents got me this and it was so much better than an iPad!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Merzuk Hozanovic
Reviews.Content: i both this package for christmas present last year, and it was a great investment they love it plus i didn't have to shop around for games batteries came with everithing

Reviews.Title: Great LeapPad Bundle
Reviews.Author: E. Volenec "Certified Reading Specialist"
Reviews.Content: We already love Leapfrog products and this one was no different. In the box, I found the following items:-Doc McStuffins Themed LeapPad-Rechargeable Battery Pack-Charger-$20 App Card-Two Extra Styluses in Pink and Purple.Set up was a little difficult. You have to download a program from LeapFrog's website. The program installed on my computer easily, but when I was installing apps, it kept losing the connection to the LeapPad. Finally, I was able to get it to go through, but it took about an hour.The LeapPad itself is great. My child has hurled it across the room, and it is sturdy and does not break (wouldn't recommend trying this, but two-year-olds and tantrums sometimes result in this effect).The apps are a little expensive, but sometimes app cards are on sale, and LeapFrog also offers discounts on bundles and multi-app discounts.Overall, I would purchase this. LeapFrog has some excellent learning apps that are included and can be purchased. You can also purchase an app and install your own music.

Reviews.Title: LeapPad 2
Reviews.Author: Brenda King
Reviews.Content: Great buy at Amazon.Very durable and the kids love it.Dropped many times, and so far, so good.It is definitely worth having the cover.

Reviews.Title: Quit working, and customer "support" is awful
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas present, and it stopped working within a month - it wouldn't start up.  Tried calling the customer support number, only to find a homicide-inducing repeating song and caution that phone support callers wait for long periods for a response.  Emails to the customer support people resulted in laughable efforts to fix my problem (no, I didn't need new batteries, but thanks for sending them).I had to pay the shipping to have the device sent to LeapFrog, where they did something to make it start again, only to fail again within 3 weeks.  When emailing them again, their response was ""Your LeapPad2 was working during our test; thus, it was sent back to you. We can have the device tested again but you will have to send it back to us and pay for shipping."The quality of the device is poor, and the customer service seems to be even worse.  I will not be buying another LeapFrog device based on this experience, and suggest people that are considering this as an option for a child look at other products)

Reviews.Title: LeapPad2
Reviews.Author: Patricia Lopez
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful to have a very simple item that a 3 year old can use without much help. The only thing I havent let him do is connect it when the battery runs out but I assure him that I will let him do it when he is a little older.

Reviews.Title: More convenient LeapPad2 rechargeable
Reviews.Author: Nuknuk

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html/ref=cm_ciu_vr_mo1HI6BQOO99NLH/186-3917480-2766206?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1HI6BQOO99NLHcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1HI6BQOO99NLHcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:31 MinsMy daughter has been using LeapPads since she was about 3. One thing I can say about LeapPads is that the absence of WiFI is both an advantage and a disadvantage. Being they are targeted for much smaller kids and primarily for education, without WiFI it is a safer device in terms of contents and the risk of getting viruses. But without WiFI, it also limits the device's capability. Specially annoying when you need to download a game or needs an update. You will always need it to be plugged with a cable tethered to your PC.Difference between the regular LeapPad2 and LeapPad2 Power:- The biggest difference is the rechargeable batteries and AC power adapter- Calculator, Calendar, Note Pad and Clock. My daughter is excited the most with the calc.Comes with:- MicroUSB cable- 2 styluses- AC adapter- Rechargeable batteriesPros:- No WiFI- Educational- Will also work with regular four double As- We have dropped it many times and still chugging-a-long- Rechargeable- Can play purchased movies from the LeapPad site. She love the Barbie movies.Cons:- No WiFi- Disappointing battery life. You will find charging it more often compared to an iPad or Nintendo handhelds- Downloading a game or an update is not user friendly. Sometimes you would need to do it a few times and sometimes it would not even update.

Reviews.Title: Disney Junior Doc McStuffins
Reviews.Author: Celeste "Vodka, Apple Pucker & Sweet 'n' Sour"
Reviews.Content: First off, I just assumed that this came with a Doc McStuffins game. To be clear, it does not. At the time of this review, this version costs about ten bucks more than the pink version. For the extra money, you get a few wallpapers and a couple of extra stylus plus a $20 download card. I’m not sure how much use you will get out of the extra stylus as the stylus connects to the LeapPad. Generally, I would say that unless your child is a pretty hard-core Doc McStuffins fan, going with the plain pink LeapPad2 may be a better option.As for the LeapPad itself, it has some great upgrades from the previous LeapPad. The two way camera is awesome. My daughter loves to take videos and pictures of herself.

Reviews.Title: Not working!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sarah L. Lippert
Reviews.Content: My son has a Leap pad2 so I bought this one as a present for my daughter.  She has had it since Christmas 2013 and 3 months later it is not working.  She is only allowed to use it when I am with her and we put it out of reach when not in use.  It acts like it is out of batteries but when we try to charge it, it won't turn on.  Then when we move the batteries around or plug in and take batteries out or do some sort of trick, we can get it to turn on.  Then eventually it just turns off and you can't get it to turn back on.  I went on Amazon to try to return it and it says we are out of our window.  So disappointing.  I think we got a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my 5 year old daughter for Christmas, knowing she LOVES Doc McStuffins. I was a little apprehensive about giving it as a gift as she hadn't asked for anything like it. She loved this game system. She is constantly using the camera and switching the skins. She knows how to do everything she needs for it to function. I like that it came with a charger, so we aren't wasting a ton of money on batteries. I also like that it came with extra styluses. The cons I have found were that it took a very long time to set up. I wanted to make sure it was charged and completely ready for Christmas morning. I believe it took 2 hours to set up! I had to update the Leap Frog connect on my computer twice before I was able to download games and then put in her information. I am also disappointed in the computer software, but that is another story for another day. Oh, and the games are expensive. Thankfully it comes with a few and I was fortunate enough to find some ebook cartridges for alot cheaper at a local store. It would've been very disappointing if they didn't include the $20 giftcard.Overall,we are very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Great LeapPad Bundle with Battery Recharger
Reviews.Author: Gadget Girl
Reviews.Content: We have two other Leappads (A Leap Pad 1 and a Monsters Univ. Bundle Leap Pad 2).  The Doc McStuffins LeapPad 2 Power Bundle is my favorite and in my opinion the best value.  This bundle includes a battery recharger and AC adapter, which is worth its weight in gold (actual value: $40).  It also includes a $20 download card for the LeapFrog store, two extra styli (one purple, one pink) as well as a USB cord.We already have a variety of games and eBook cartridges (Cinderella, Bubble Guppies, Dora, Phineas and Ferb, iSpy, Jake and Neverland Pirates, etc). The downlard card can be used in LeapFrog AppCenter to purchase games, ebooks and videos.  Browsing content and uploading to the LeapPad is simple.  You can install the same content on multiple LeapPads in your family.  We've mostly purchased videos such as episodes of Dora and Bubble Guppies for restaurants and car rides.  The drawing app that comes with the LeapPad is also a favorite of my daughter.Setup is relatively simple using LeapFrog Connect software.  The features that the LeapPad 2 adds above the original Leappad is a front-facing camera, more memory (4 GB vs 2 GB) and better battery life.  The LeapPad 2 Power adds the battery recharger and AC adapter but is otherwise the same product.  (Though this bundle comes with 2 extra styli and usually you get 1 extra).Let me tell you, the included battery recharger is worth its weight in gold!  The Leap Pad 1 drains batteries and the battery case was difficult to open (had to use stylus or a penny).  The Leappad 2 adds a better batter compartment, but the LeapPad 2 power includes the battery recharger... it's easy to use and lasts about 8 hours of use.  It can be recharged using the AC adapter without having the remove the batteries from the compartment.  In an "emergency" you could still swap out the battery recharger for four AA batteries (regular or rechargeable), but with the longer battery life, this should not be needed in everyday use.The Doc McStuffins design is very cute - my 4 year old daughter is a huge fan of the show.  The Amazon frustration free packaging made it easy to open and get started.  No clamshell or excess packaging, just a few cardboard separators and a few twist ties for the cords.  The batteries came with some charge and you can set up the LeapPad right out of the box.  You can create a profile for up to 3 children on the same device, plus a "Guest" user.  However, to use any of the content you must first hook to the LeapFrog Connect Application via a computer.  If you are giving this as a gift and you know your child will want to check it out right away, you could set it up and put it back into the box without much trouble.Overall, the LeapPad 2 Power is a great product for kids age 3-9.  Some of the apps are a little challenging for my 4 year old, but she will grow into the device with time.  I don't have to worry about durability or her breaking it.  It's nice and solid, her LeapPad (original) is still going strong (though no longer used often since we've upgraded due to better battery life on the LeapPad 2s). This is a great educational product from LeapFrog and there is a nice variety of content available for early learning.

Reviews.Title: Great Product.
Reviews.Author: Mercedes
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my purchase of the Tablet with the Gel Skin and Carrying Case for my 3 1/2 year old.

Reviews.Title: Diappointing.
Reviews.Author: Jan Herzik
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my grandsons and am really disappointed. The games are extremely expensive.  Purchasing a simple tablet-type device for apps to be downloaded would have been more economical and provided more diversity.

Reviews.Title: Daughter loves!
Reviews.Author: Chanti Cooper Groh
Reviews.Content: This has been a great bundle, easy to navigate for our four year old daughter. It has traveled well with us since she received it for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: You will buy apps . . . many many apps. . .
Reviews.Author: Lulu Moretti
Reviews.Content: A neighbor kid loaned my 6 and 4 year olds his LeapPad. They loved it. So much to do. So much fun. So, of course, I ordered one for their very own. It arrived. I charged it. Gave it to them. Disappointment in extremis. "It doesn't have anything. There's nothing to do." were the complaints. I asked the neighbor's father why his unit was so much better. After all, his was the LeapPad, an older model, and I'd bought the LeapPad2 - could there be that great a difference? Had the apps in #2 been stripped away? He laughed and  explained that the units arrive bare bones and the object of the whole game is to pressure the adults into buying the apps. Lots and lots of expensive apps. A modest "app bundle" is $80. He said he's "dropped at least $200 worth of apps" into his son's unit. Also, there are some things that are really painful for little girls: click on the 'Tangled' icon and you get NOT a princess app, but an ad to buy the Tangled app. grrrHaving said all that, if you are happy spending and spending (as the LeapFrog folks intend that you do) then this could be OK for you. I'm buying a Kindle HD 7 for the kids which they'll be able to enjoy for years.

Reviews.Title: Leap pad
Reviews.Author: Phillippa
Reviews.Content: My grandaughter loves her Leap Pad and has numerous hours of enjoyment from it, but I find the games expensive here in NZ and not a great selection.

Reviews.Title: My 2 year old daughter loves this product!
Reviews.Author: Christian BookWorm "Kee"
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old daughter loves this product! Love the colors, simple set up and ease of use. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet, Power is the Way To Go
Reviews.Author: J. Chenery
Reviews.Content: This is a great learning tablet. I gave mine to my nephew for Christmas and he loves it. I'm a gadget fanatic and was so excited to give him his first real gadget. I think the biggest success factor with this product is how you use it. The tablet is preloaded with some basic apps and functionality, but there are so many apps, books, games, etc that you can buy to tailor the experience for your little one. My nephew is 2 and a half years old and it's amazing how he can use this on his own. It's built like a tank and has held up well so far. Oh and definitely get the kit with rechargeable batteries and power cord or you'll be out a fortune in buying replacement batteries.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: My kids loved these on christmas when santa brought them to our house :) !!!  They are amazing, my kids love to play all the learning games and I even downloaded disney princess music on it for them to dance too.  Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Leap Frog 2
Reviews.Author: Pamela Marshall
Reviews.Content: The battery doesn't hold very well(even though it is plug in charging) I am stillwaiting for the extended warranty I purchased.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for a One and Half Year Old and He Loves It
Reviews.Author: Sue in CT
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know it states 3 and up but Damien is always trying to grab our phones so for Christmas I got him this. He is too young for a lot of things either already on it or in the "store" but there are plenty of videos for 2 year olds to help them from learning to talk to ABC's plus he also likes the games although he don't quite understand it yet. (His favorite is turning it off and on). I love that it seems well built for little hands and adding games, videos, or other things is a snap at the LeapFrog online (site comes with it). There are a lot to choose from as well as the added bonus of not going store to store looking for it and getting it right away (download it, it is easy) plus it 'grows' with the child. No matter 3 years old or 6 years old, something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: helped my son read he was havig trouble!
Reviews.Author: Eve
Reviews.Content: Im very happy I bought this. My son just turned seven and is having troubkes reading. I bought him the frog readig game and the monsters inc game and it has actually imrpoved over a few weeks alog with reading normal books! Im happy! THANK GOD!

Reviews.Title: LEAPFROG LEAPPAD 2LEARNING TABLET.
Reviews.Author: diane ashby
Reviews.Content: A GREAT LEARNING TOOL FOR MY 3 YR OLD GRANDSON WHO LOVES PLAYING AND LEARNING FROM THE GAMES AND A GREAT  WAY TO KEEP HIM ENTERTAIN.

Reviews.Title: Love the Leapfrog
Reviews.Author: James A. Nichols
Reviews.Content: Leapfrog continues to make very educational products and this is the Leappad2.  This bundle comes with the Leappad2 which has a special Doc McStuffins design which is mainly purple and pink and is geared towards girls.  I also love that it comes with the rechargeable batteries and the $20 app card.  This is a great bundle to get started with for those new to the Leapfrog family. The new Leappad2 has 4GB of memory instead of 2Gb.  Also love that they added a front facing camera to go along with the rear facing one.  As always all of the leapfrog Explorer games are still compatible so if you have an older model your games will still work on this one.  MY boy(ages 6, 6, and 5) all have so much fun with this and the games are very educational.  I really love the educational part of these products that make your kids think while having fun at the same time

Reviews.Title: Loads of fun especially on the run
Reviews.Author: L. Steiner
Reviews.Content: This tablet is perfect for a child who is interested in having his/her own tablet, but is not ready for the responsibility of caring for an expensive grown-up tablet.The apps/games it comes with are minimal, but my 3-year old grandson greatly enjoys the built-in camera and pet care app that comes pre-installed. There are not a huge number of items (there are apps, storybooks and videos) that can be downloaded from the Leapfrog site, but there are enough to keep a young child entertained.  Those that are available are educational, reasonably priced for the most part, and feature characters that your child will already be familiar with like Team Umizoomi and Doc McStuffins.  If I had one nitpick it would be that you can't get Angry Birds for this tablet, which is the 3-year-old's favorite game.This tablet has been treated rather roughly, and dropped more than once, but seems no worse for wear.By the time your child is 5-6 they will probably outgrow this, but if your 3-year-old is jealous of your or his/her older sibling's tablet, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog
Reviews.Author: Carmen Crume
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my grandson because he loves playing with his dads ipad.  He uses it quite often.  So glad i got it for him.

Reviews.Title: Doc McStuffins bundle is a great deal, even if you're not a Doc McStuffins fan
Reviews.Author: Silea
Reviews.Content: I'd actually never heard of Doc McStuffins before i got this, but it's a hit with my child who loves pink and purple. The styluses are a different shade of purple than the normal ones, plus there's a hot pink one too. The wallpapers are cute-but-not-cutesy. The $20 gift card will buy three or four non-movie-tie-in games, and LeapFrog has some great educational games (the cooking one is teaching our preschooler fractions).I have some trouble with LeapPads overall - they're very slow to start up or load games. Clearly one of the reasons this devices can stay under $100 is because they don't have top-of-the-line processors and such, but start-up can take so long that my kid actually wanders off and starts playing with something else instead. Some of the apps are also very pestering, like the drawing app that takes 5 seconds of inactivity as a cue that it should remind you, for the billionth time, how to select a drawing tool.But as i mention above, amidst the money-grab movie-tie-in games that'll set you back a pile of cash for very simple gameplay, there are the LeapFrog games that teach math, science, logic, problem solving, and other useful skills. My preschooler is already starting to resist 'work time' at school, with number and letter worksheets, but will play the cooking game for half an hour straight and clearly have learned from it.A full charge of the LeapPad battery pack lasts longer than four AA batteries, too, which is great. We got awfully tired of burning through batteries on the previous LeapPad.

Reviews.Title: Amazon great, LeapFrog not so much
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Borkenhagen
Reviews.Content: Bought this bundle for our grandchildren for Christmas and they really enjoyed playing with it until the screen cracked. Contacted LeapFrog and was told they could do nothing, so much for a warranty. There response was to contact Amazon. Amazon was terrific they sent out a new bundle and had it delivered the next day, plus sent return address label for the broken device.Really am dissatisfied with dealing with LeapFrog any time I have called them they can do nothing, asked them to remove the defective device from our account, was told they could not do it.

Reviews.Title: NICE!
Reviews.Author: Luci V
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised.  It works great, and has done just what it is suppose to do. which is exactly what I wanted!

Reviews.Title: Way to go, Santa!
Reviews.Author: Momma Weng
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth between the LeapPad and Vtech tablet for my 3 year olds Christmas gift but Santa brought him this one. I like that it holds his attention for 20-30 minutes at a time and has games at his skill level. We haven't had any problems with the power charging and enjoy the variety of games.

Reviews.Title: Best Item Ever!
Reviews.Author: NCGirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my two year old for Christmas. She loves it. This was the only place I could find a Doc McStuffins bundle. Everywhere else I looked I only found like the Barbie. Very satisfies. It is still going strong even tho it has been in every nook and cranny she can find but she does play with it every day and I am seeing that she has progressed in her learing with it. I do recommend purchasing a case for it tho. My daughter has dropped it numerous times but the case has protected it. It arrived on time and in great packaging. Would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Remember, this isn't even close to an iPad. But who cares, the kids love it!
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Liptak "lip89"
Reviews.Content: Lets forget about the other reviews comparing this to an iPad. It will never be one and I am not sure it is trying to even be one or any tablet for that matter. This is geared towards 2 to really 6 or 7 year olds and the graphics are sub par and game play is just okay but thats what it was meant to be. It is a learning device and as the kids play, they learn without even knowing it. My son could spend an hour on Subway Surfer and not learn a thing except how to jump trains. This lets you either download games or buy cartridges and contains other things like a camera, an art coloring page and a MP3 player. Its easy to use and my kids love it and so far they love the games too. I downloaded a few more from the Leapfrog website and hooked it up to the computer and it was quick and easy. A bit of problem first downloading software to my MAC, but worked it out with the support section of the website. I would so far recommend this device!

Reviews.Title: ehhhhh I wish the description actually matched the product I received.
Reviews.Author: Kianna Young
Reviews.Content: I didn't at all know I could not connect to the Wifi with this tablet and it. Since it doesn't connect to the Wifi the free games should be automatically applied for those without a computer to download it from the leapfrog website. My daughter likes it so I guess that's what really matters in the end.

Reviews.Title: Great learning tool for today's grandkids!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Volk
Reviews.Content: This is a super device from LeapFrog that has entertained, interacted and allowed all three of my grandchild to learn in an age appropriate manner.  Thanks LeapFrog!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: msmissy
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my niece's 5th birthday and she ABSOLUTELY LOVES it!! Nothing like having fun while learning. Great Gift

Reviews.Title: best toy ever
Reviews.Author: MamaCoop "busy momma"
Reviews.Content: If your wondering whether or not to get the leappad 2 or older version go with this one! My daughter loves the 2 way camera and the screen is very big and useful.  The Power is hands down the best because you can recharge.  the life of the battery lasts a long time.  My daughter is 4 and loves this!

Reviews.Title: Get One, Get One
Reviews.Author: Greg Smith
Reviews.Content: If you want your child to have fun, learning new things then get this!! But, make sure you get the one with power pack like this or for boys. The cheaper ones won't last that long. There is always going to be plenty of games for it. Doesn't take long to recharge. We have about 6 games so far, an almost everyday our 3 yr old spends about 1-2 hours on this. Then if we go on a road trip, she got something to pre-occupy herself with. So - yes GET ONE!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Product
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson who turned 5 in January , he loves this, uses it everyday,  Great product. I would recommend for any child that loves to play games, and the best part is they are learning as they play.. 10 Star Rating if possible !

Reviews.Title: Nice bundle
Reviews.Author: J. Hansen
Reviews.Content: We have had many different Leapster solutions, from the explorer, GS, LeapPad, and now even a LeapPad Ultra. Overall, they're all great products, but this is the first "Power" version we've ever had (that wasn't an Ultra). In the past, we've typically used rechargeable batteries, but it's nice to be able to have a LeapPad 2 that is rechargeable. Overall, it makes it more simple, and the kids can even plug it in to continue to play if the batteries die.In terms of this being a Doc McStuffins specific bundle, my 2 year old daughter is a big fan of Doc. We had previously given her a green LeapPad 2, but this one was so much better for her. She loves the included Doc backgrounds, and the designs on the device itself. As others have said, it is a bit sad they didn't include the actual Doc McStuffins game. That being said, we did already own it, so it wouldn't have been much of a benefit for us anyway. I do feel like other bundles I've seen had the game included, but I may be mistaken. The $20 download card is always a nice plus, and could certainly be used to purchase the game. Leapfrog always has discount codes, so it's pretty easy to get a game like Doc McStuffins for under $20 (regularly $25).Other than the above, it's a pretty normal LeapPad 2. It works great (lots better than the technical issues of the LeapPad Ultra). Very solid, well built product, and it's great for kids.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Baiyinah Rahim
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my 4 year old son and he loves it, every time he has it he plays it for hours we have to take from him from time to time.lol. Its a great learning/entertainment tool for long trips and so on. Really enjoyed this product

Reviews.Title: So not worth it - maybe 1.5 stars
Reviews.Author: Dienne
Reviews.Content: My five-year-old daughter has been wanting a Leap Pad for about six months now since she played her cousin's, so I was happy to get the opportunity to try this one.  Boy am I glad we didn't spend money on it.The good points of this device begin and end with the ease of set up.  Out of the box, the Leap Pad will be ready to use in about ten minutes of hooking up to the internet and downloading from the Leap Frog website.When my daughter first got the Leap Pad, she dove right into it and played most of the rest of the day, pausing only when we insisted that she give her older sister a turn to satisfy her curiosity.  I was relieved that finally she won't be pestering me for my smartphone all the time.After playing with it again the next day for less than an hour, however, my daughter asked me for my phone again.  By the end of the week she had practically forgotten about the Leap Pad and was right back with the phone.  While giving in and letting her borrow my phone, I decided to see what this Leap Pad is all about.  Didn't take me more than 5 minutes to want my phone back.The package includes nine apps when you initially connect to the Leap Frog website.  Among these are a decent art program, a pet corner and a game that "teaches" the flags and various random useless facts about countries the majority of adults have never heard of.  There is also a calculator, a clock and a couple other apps your average preschooler will never touch.  To the extent she has used it at all since the initial days, my daughter only uses the pet and art apps.The package also includes a $20 download card in order to load more programs from the Leap Frog website.  At first I was pretty impressed.  The apps range from $5 and up and you get a discount the more apps you buy.  The apps include games, videos, ebooks and other sorts of "educational" material.  I was able to get five apps, so I was pretty happy.  At first the new apps didn't download to the device properly and my daughter couldn't find them, but my husband hooked the device back up to the internet and the problem resolved itself.The problem is, the apps are junk.  The games are very simplistic and repetitive.  Among the games we got, there were two themes.  Three of the games involved inserting missing pieces to create a complete tube or waterslide to get from one end of a path to the other.  Two of the games involved patterns of moving objects out of the way to "free" something (a polar bear, for instance).  The one ebook we got was insulting, even for a preschooler's cognitive level and my daughter didn't want to touch it again.I'm sure our mistake was choosing the cheaper alternatives.  I'm guessing that the apps that cost $20 and up may hold your child's attention better.  But who wants to spend that kind of money on a child's toy that already costs nearly $100?  It's just a continual black hole sucking money straight out of your wallet.  You can also choose cartridges which can at least be shared among friends, but they are also expensive and are probably easily lost.Once you set up the device and register your child(ren), Leap Frog will send you periodic updates regarding your child's "progress".  This is to give further credibility to Leap Pad as an "educational learning tool".  The fact is, however, there is little that is educational about this or any other electronic gadget.  Memorizing facts is not "learning".  Age appropriate learning for a preschooler involves hands-on exploration and discovery, pretend play, engagement with parents and other adults, as well as interaction with peers.  None of that is offered - and, in fact, is stilted - by isolated, controlled "play" on a gadget.In any case, in this modern world, electronic gadgets may be nearly unavoidable.  If you really think your youngster needs a gadget, a simple small tablet would probably be a better option.  There are plenty of free games and other apps for tablets.  It may not look as inviting and "child-friendly" as this device with its two extra styluses and Doc McStuffins wallpaper, but it's a much better deal in the long run.Update 3/13/14:  Two other things I forgot to mention.  First, the Leap Pad is equipped with a camera, but it takes such bad pictures, your child will probably not want to use this feature more than once.  Second, on the pet app, your child can wash his/her pet which involves, among other things, blowing into part of the device to dry off the pet, which the kids think is fun, but I find a bit bizarre.  I don't know whether the germ factor bothers me more (especially since it's designed to be shared among up to three kids) or the fact that it's eerily like a breathalyzer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome learning toy kid tough!!!
Reviews.Author: Amanda gentle
Reviews.Content: This is a must have for little kids! My son is already smarter. He is 2! For young kids, I highly recommend the Crayola art game! It also comes with cameras, free games, etc. which CAN be used without an internet connection! I was concerned that I would have to have a computer to set it up to use but I don't!

Reviews.Title: We only kept this for a day and sent it back.
Reviews.Author: Carol Klinefelter "C.A. KLINE"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my 4 year old and when I found out how much each game cost to purchase for this system, I was shocked! It only came with a handful of games and they weren't so great.  I had bought my two older children tablets (Android) from Walmart for $59 each and you can download all the games for free! I sent this back and and bought my 4 year old the same tablet and she can download all the free learning games and it cost much less (even with the protective case) than this LeapFrog.  I just felt it was a money eater.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves playing with it.
Reviews.Author: Patricia Brouillette
Reviews.Content: It is all that I expect from a LeapPad 2. For the price you get the rechargeable batteries, which cost $30+ on Amazon, and a $20 card to buy games that you can download for the LeapPad 2. My daughter has another LeapPad that someone gave her, and this is her favorite of the two.My daughter loves Doc Mcstuffin, so she really loves this LeapPad. It is worth getting.

Reviews.Title: Better than the iPad?
Reviews.Author: Jill W
Reviews.Content: We have twin 4yo boys. This past Christmas I thought long and hard about buying a LeapFrog LeapPad2 as their big "Santa" gift. We have iPads and iPhones that we let them use occasionally, which they love, but I've always been a LeapFrog fan for the educational value, so I was very interested in this toy. But I didn't want to buy it if they were going to ignore it in favor of the iPad. I decided to just buy one and see how it went, then if they both loved it, and I liked the apps, we'd get a second so they wouldn't fight over it. Well, it's been a couple months, and I'm starting to shop for a second one! They really do love it, and I feel like the apps are good quality and educational (although on the spendy side compared to iPad apps, which are also educational). I would highly recommend this toy for kids age 3 and up…especially if you don't want to share your iPad!

Reviews.Title: Learning tools
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: My grandchildren love this! They are able to focus on a variety of skills without even knowing they are doing it. The only reason I rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is the new games are $25 each so it becomes expensive

Reviews.Title: Great for a toddler
Reviews.Author: Sara Pedersen
Reviews.Content: This is really an awesome product that I really was debating on purchasing because my daughter was only 2.5 but she has done well with guidance and has done a good job taking care of it.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: my 4 year old love "his computer".  It is sturdy, very cute games that help him learn secretly.  Helping with his penmenship too.  I highly recommend this one.  Easy for them to use.  Not too loud.  Just make sure you get a screen cover.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Karen Haena
Reviews.Content: For the price I like the leap pad I just wish the games were not so expensive.I thought it would be like itunes and be able to get some free stuff.

Reviews.Title: My son's gift
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Jobe
Reviews.Content: He loves his leappad. The only problem I have with it is that I have to now purchase these games. The games could be a bit cheaper

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog LeapPad2 power learning tablet
Reviews.Author: Dixie Lee
Reviews.Content: The battery falls out.  it isn't very sturdy.  We got another one for another grandchild and it is perfect.  Practically indistructible.  I have put in a request for repair or replacement.

Reviews.Title: Good investment
Reviews.Author: sunshine
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 4 year old granddaughter for Christmas and she has already gotten more apps and cartridges from others for her birthday. Loves to play with it and use it instead of her parent's grown up tablet.  I researched this tablet weeks before buying and really liked the recharge deal that comes with it.  We hope to hand this down to little brothers as she gets older and more advanced.  Other reviews recommended this idea.

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog Leappad2
Reviews.Author: TerryLynn
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift. Little girls loved it. Their only complaint was it took to long to recharge. From a child's  standpoint. But it is a great learning tool. These little girls are always on and learning.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my soon to be pre-schooler
Reviews.Author: melinda
Reviews.Content: My daughter has never been in any type of learning environment such as daycare or sunday school and will be starting pre K this fall. We have done some print out learning things with her at home but wanted to make sure she was really headed in the right direction with learning, to get her ready for Pre K this year. She loves it. She loves everything about it, the games, the camera, the fact she has her own "tablet" She has learned a lot. I would def. recommend a friend to buy.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it!
Reviews.Author: Crystal D. Macalinao
Reviews.Content: I got this for my almost 2 year old daughter because she loves Doc Mcstuffins. She frequents the doc office because she has Noonan Syndrome and has had congenital heart defects since birth. So i think this makes her a little more comfortable at her doctor visits.  I love the rechargeable pack. If you do get this make sure you get the recharge pack cuz it comes in handy.

Reviews.Title: Please read before buying... Innotab 2 vs the LeapPad2
Reviews.Author: JamesFirth
Reviews.Content: This may look like a tablet but don't be fooled. I am not going to give it a bad review but am only going to compare it to Innotab 2 which I had returned in order to get this for my three year old.What makes this deal seem interesting is that they give you a 20 dollar card to spend on their market. Let me repeat, their market! Unlike the Innotab 2, which allows you to youtube, upload music and movies, and other things similar to what a typical tablet will do (bare minimum), the Leap Pad 2 allows only their products which are pretty expensive. I must add though, if you get two or more games, videos etc from their website, they will give you a discount. But these games are still 25 a pop. And none free to get either which is ridiculous. That means no outside parties are allowed to add anything to this monopolized market they call the Leap Pad store.However faster than the Innotab 2 with a way better camera, that doesn't compensate for the lack of stuff I can do on an Leappad2. Granted, my 3 year old gives a crap about stuff and more about Mickey Mouse!!! So my problem is a daddy issue and not a kid issue. I have to admit, I either want the Innotab 2 back just for more versatility (so slow though), or I want something in between these two devices.The 20 dollar gift card did get me a couple items only because they give you a discount. Just remember, Innotab 2 lets you do whatever but horrible camera and speeds while Leappad 2 gives you NO VERSATILITY but decent camera and decent speeds. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Kids love this product
Reviews.Author: Priscilla Slater
Reviews.Content: Great learning tool for kids. Great for long rides. We love how the batteries are rechargeable.  Good for ages 2 yr-7 yr.

Reviews.Title: Never Again?!?
Reviews.Author: bree
Reviews.Content: After saying I would never buy another LeapFrog product again... I did. I regret it. Screen is so small. Should have just bought my 3 year old a Kindle. Games are too expensive and the $20 gift card I got with it will barely buy anything for it.

Reviews.Title: Son wont put it down
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Christmas for my 4 year old and he absolutely loves playing on it. Some days I can't get it away from him. I love the educational games for the leap pad, he doesn't even know he's learning.

Reviews.Title: love!
Reviews.Author: amanda skinner
Reviews.Content: VERY cute set! My daughter (4 years old) loves doc mcstuffins (and I do too). I loved that it came with the charger and the gift card. definitely worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog LeapPad2
Reviews.Author: Sheena Straker
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery. Very educational for my 3 year old cousin. Two icons that increased his learning ability was word choice for the alphabet, tracing the alphabet/words.

Reviews.Title: LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power  - Disney Junior Doc McStuffins Bundle LeapFrog
Reviews.Author: HYUNG KYUNG YOON
Reviews.Content: it was best production.its fare is best.but it was not upgrade.so it is uneasy.i'm sure a good gift.

Reviews.Title: Educational and Entertaining!
Reviews.Author: jmlm77
Reviews.Content: Our first LeapPad2 Power stopped registering the touch of the stylus.  We must have just purchased a lemon.  Amazon replaced it with ease and my 4 and 7 year old can't get enough of it now!  Highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: A great gift
Reviews.Author: Turtleview
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a six year old who was just thrilled with it.  So many great applications for fun filled learning.  A good investment.  Two months later, it is still a favorite... Always something new

Reviews.Title: Great for our 3 year old
Reviews.Author: Victoria Peters
Reviews.Content: We like the educational benefit of the leap frog. We purchased for our 3 year grandson in effort to get him started on technology and reinforce some basic principles that he is being taught every day in his classroom.

Reviews.Title: Buy a kindle fire HD 7" with a good protective cover instead and save some money.
Reviews.Author: Ajax840
Reviews.Content: This device is locked down for money generating purposes by LeapFrog. By the time anyone puts a few apps on it or buys a couple of cartridges, they will have spent the same amount as they could have on a kindle fire HD 7". Put a few more on and you've covered the cost of the otterbox cover for the kindle fire HD 7" as well. Want to put your own media on this device? That will cost you as you have to buy an app for that. Want to do anything other than the basics that are included? That will cost you money. The kindle has access to many free apps that will not cost you any money and are great for kids. I do like how durable the LeapPad2 is as it can take some abuse, but so can a kindle with the right protective case. My child got bored with this is less than a month since he was also exposed to a kindle at nearly the same time. To recap, if you plan on putting as few as 10 apps on the LeapPad2 you will have spent what the kindle fire HD 7" costs. Also, my son was able to scratch the screen on the first day of use. For a touch screen tablet designed for use by young children, this is not reassuring.

Reviews.Title: Leapfrog, you're cheating the parents!
Reviews.Author: P. Teodor
Reviews.Content: Well I have to say this one is a big flop for me! I bought it for my son, who is almost 4 years old, and I thought I strike gold. It turned out that all the applications that you have to buy from Leapfrog (only) are damn expensive. It might be the most educational tablet on the market - gosh I hope I'll never again gave in to those marketing ads - I can't say much about it right now, but with prices of 10-25 USD for every small application that your kid will use for 2-3 days tops, until he finishes all the levels, this makes me, as a parent, feel cheated and robbed. Leapfrog lost a lot of its credibility with this approach and I am pretty sure they will loose lots of customers as well. One of them is going to be me!

Reviews.Title: Leap Pad 2 replacement screen
Reviews.Author: Jogeshwar Goberdan
Reviews.Content: Hi, screen..Leappad 2 was working great, however, my 2 year son drop it and the screen is broken, I would like to have the screen replaced. What I need to do? Do you have screen to sell?RegardsGoberdan

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: karry j. violette
Reviews.Content: My grandkids loved these.  Favorite gifts for Christmas.  Loved having the battery charger included...Perfect for 5 & 7 yr old.

Reviews.Title: Entertaining and educational
Reviews.Author: Branham
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our 2.5 yo. We were afraid she'd prefer our ipad to this but she loves it. The apps are expensive so we try to purchase games while on sale. Her 4 yo brother steals it to play the educational games that she doesn't quite grasp.

Reviews.Title: i hate it
Reviews.Author: midsy27
Reviews.Content: BE CAREFUL WITH THIS ITEM ,I BUY NEW ONE WHEN I OPEN  IT FOR THE SETTING IT WAS A DAMAGE ITEM ,AND AMAZON DON'T WANT TO CHANGE IT CAUSE I 'M NOT IN USA NOW  AND THEY DON'T WANT TO PAY THE INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING COST FOR THE RETURN .DON'T BUY IT ON AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "mommy"
Reviews.Content: This bundle is a very good deal! Got one for my daughter and my niece, they love them. Who doesn't love Doc McStuffins?  The charger pack is a must because leap pads go through a ridiculous amount of batteries. $20 card will pay for their first game, extra stylus' always come in handy.

Reviews.Title: Love this item
Reviews.Author: C. Barnes
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the "Big" gift for our 2 year old this Christmas.  She loves it!  I love that it recharges.  Lots more memory than Leap Pad 1 - which is great.  Just need to add a gel skin and you are set.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet! So happy we got it!
Reviews.Author: T. Lewis
Reviews.Content: This Leap Pad 2 has been great! Both my 5 and 7 year old love it. We are the kind of family that wants to delay our kids exposure to electronics (e.g. our kids don't have video games and they don't use our cell phones either). But of course, when your kids have cousins and friends who own iPods at age 8, then it is hard to make a case without making the other parents look bad. In our case, we believe that our kids amazing imagination is a result of more play time with real toys. So we got the leap pad 2 as an alternative to those other electronics that our kids don't have. And it has been amazing. They actually are loving the camera and video feature. They make mini movies of themselves and take silly pictures. They also enjoy the other games. We only got one cartridge (rescue hero bots) and it has been very educational and entertaining. Right for my kids ages. So far we have been very pleased with it.I also wanted to mention that when we got the tablet, the battery lasted for only an hour or so. I charged for many hours but it didn't really charged. I got frustrated and regretted the purchases thinking of the reviews that I heard about the charger malfunction. I decided then to reinstall the tablet (which deleted what My son had done till then, fortunately it was not much because he just got it) and then try to charge it again. Then it worked perfectly. No problems since then. Happy costumers!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Richard Fredette
Reviews.Content: My 4 year old grand daughter love the leap frog. I thought she was to young but I was wrong. She plays with it in the car and at home. She will learn from this game.

Reviews.Title: Leap pad 2
Reviews.Author: my2cents#1
Reviews.Content: I would suggest skipping this device if your kid is five or above. The device is great. Here are a few things I do not like about it;-It  doesn't come with a button to reduce brightness on the screen like the previous leapster explorer device did. Therefore under dim light conditions it can be bothersome to your kids eyes-the battery life on this unit is poor compared to the leapster explorer that my kiddo has- the device is heavy for a younger kid, very slick and will break if you do not use a caseLeap frog products have been in our house for a very long time. I truly believe that kids are able to play and learn at the same time using their educational toys. However, leap pad has been a disappointment considering the other units out there that can serve the same purpose with the ability to grow with your kid.This device is great if you want your kid to have alone play time and don't want to worry about them drifting to other sites. If your kid is old enough to follow some rules and directions, kindle would be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: Great learning tool
Reviews.Author: Mariannekmilks "ceramician"
Reviews.Content: This children's learning computer is going to a small public library in Nepal next week. It will be an unknown and excellent addition to the library, hopefully pulling more children and adults in to see whatever more one finds in libraries! It is very easy to use, and the various learning cassettes are perfect.

Reviews.Title: SMA Loves gift
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I love that my grandson who is three yeas old loves his leapfrog which is interactive. It is teaching him how to operate the system on his own through instructions. When the leapfrog isn't on he is still singing the educational songs. Tracing the alphabets is just what he needs to practice letter recognition along with preparing for writing.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: deborah
Reviews.Content: Dis iz awwwwwwwsome I recommend Dis to every child...my son iz to years old an yes he iz able to use it on his own he has learn to even trace letters by following the dots an earning points...yes my son iz only 2yrs old he also no how to switch to n e game dat he like.....I also bought download cards but it did not work in Trinidad....

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Melissa Kling
Reviews.Content: This is completely worth the purchase.. It comes with a lot of apps already on it, and you can buy games right on the leap pad website and download other ones that are appropriate for the age of your child.  I would recommend buying the case and cover for it also.  My 3 yr old has a great time using this everywhere we go and all the games are educational and have different levels you can choose.  Completely Recommend this learning tablet.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Wright
Reviews.Content: Great product. We got it at an amazing price. The kids love to play it even with the standard apps that came with it. Easy to use for both kids 4 & 2.

Reviews.Title: Leap Frog
Reviews.Author: Leonard Torres
Reviews.Content: Our grandaughter loves her Leap Frog , hasn't put it down. It is a great product for a three year old.Looking forward to purchasing more educational games.

Reviews.Title: Works well.
Reviews.Author: S Brown
Reviews.Content: My daughter received this as a Christmas present and she loves it. She is a little young for most of the games since she is only 2, but she still enjoys it.

Reviews.Title: VERY SENSITIVE PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Gamal
Reviews.Content: BUY IT FOR MY DAUGHTER VERY PLEASED THREE YEARS SHE USE THREE DAYS AND OBSERVE THAT BROKE THE SCREEN WAS I THINK BECAUSE OF MY DAUGHTER AND I SEE BUT disarmed THE SCREEN IS VERY SENSITIVE TO SEEK TREATMENT NOT GET PARTS AND SEE THAT EBAY SELLING THE SAME PROBLEM WITH PRETTY BROKEN SCREEN mANUFACTURERS TO aSK THEM IF YOU KNOW YOU WILL USE A CHILD BECAUSE THEY DO NOT STRONGER THAN THE BUSINESS NO TABLE GAMES ARE GOING TO BUY ONE FOR USE IN FUTURE NOW DUMP it DRAGS ME OR PLACE IT ON EBAY AND SELL FOR AS OTHER PARTS.

Reviews.Title: Best Gift
Reviews.Author: Johnathon D Goldwater
